page.title: 18COLDINGHAM
page.content: THE NEAREST VILLAGE TO ST ABBS IS COLDINGHAM . IT LIES ALMOST TWO MILES INLAND AND IS QUITE DIFFERENT IN APPEARANCE AND OUTLOOK FROM ST ABBS .IT IS A MUCH OLDER VILLAGE AND HAS GROWN UP ROUND THE REMAINS OF THE PRIORY, WHICH IS NOW USED AS THE LOCAL CHURCH .THERE ARE LOTS OF BOARDING HOUSES ,SMALL HOTELS , A MOTEL AND A HOLIDAY CAMP IN COLDINGHAM AND LOTS OF PEOPLE COME ON HOLIDAY . ALTHOUGH THERE WAS A WEAVING INDUSTRY LAST CENTURY THERE IS NO INDUSTRY NOW AND MOST PEOPLE WORK OUT OF THE VILLAGE . LOTS OF NEW HOUSES ARE BEING BUILT AND WORKERS FROM THE NUCLEAR POWER STATION AT TORNESS ARE COMING TO LIVE IN COLDINGHAM . THERE ARE TWO GARAGES, A POST OFFICE ,BAKER , 2 GROCERS ,A CLOTHES SHOP , A GARDEN NURSERY AND A FISH AND CHIP CARRY-OUT. THERE IS ALSO PHOTOGRAPH MUSEUM .
